product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Seagate External Drives Stop Being Read
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 6, 2021
text: I have 2 Seagate External Drives, a 1 TB and a 2 TB. It's concerning both stopped being read consistently but not at the same time.  Trying to copy files for back up, the 2 TB started real soon after buying it, disconnecting repeatedly while copying data onto it. Then it would shut off completely not to be read again at all from the PC for a long while - weeks, etc.  I travel some so didn't realize it was literally a bad non-functioning external drive so didn't realize the problem was here to stay until after the allowed refund period.  Not too long later, the 1 TB started doing the same thing, so basically I got an Element external drive that ended up not working at al.  I spent over a couple hundred dollars trying to have secure back up for very important files. Don't go with Seagate or Element.... I just want a good working external back up drive, these are not reliable brands. My PC has a lot of RAM, like 16, and I-3 Intel. It's a good system.  These things you pay a lot of money for are supposed to be good systems, they're not.  Seagate should replace both these drives - I fear now they were 'offed' on us defective, sold so they wouldn't lose money, but to the point we would. I just need a truly good back up drive & didn't have this amount of money to spare trying - very upset and disappointed by the situation and like to give good reviews not upset ones.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: AVOID for large transfers, SMR drive slow as molasses. Eventually died after 10hrs of use.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2021
text: Update 9/22After maybe 10hrs of use, put it away in a cabinet for a year. Took it out today only to find out it is unusable. It takes forever to be recognized and any write operation fail. I can hear heads retrying forever inside. This is poor quality product. Seagate used to be prime and innovative company, now it's just a dollar chasing far east corporation. Warranty replacement will probably get me refurbished one, that I will not trust and just use for temporary transfers. Skip this product.Original review:After the initial burst of high speed, this drive slows down to a crawl. Starts at 100MB/s+ for few minutes, than drops to average 6-8MB/s for the rest of the transfer, with occasional bursts to 10-30MB/s. 1.5TB of data is now estimated at 21h to complete. This is on a fresh drive out of the box. Obviously SMR drive. Absolute waste of time.If you are using it to occasionally backup few files, you'll be OK, if you are thinking about transferring large sets of data frequently, look elsewhere.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Cannot partition drive, can't change the partition map, limited formats.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 8, 2021
text: Overall, I am disappointed in this drive.  Using Mac OS, on can't repartition the drive.  As such the Partition Map is locked to being "Master Boot Record".  It comes formatted for NTFS (Windows) but reformatting the drive only allows for Mac OS Extended (Journaled), Mac OS Extended (case-sensitive, Journaled), MSDOS-FAT, and ExFAT.  It does not provide for the newer APFS format, something that Time Machine prefers to use in the current version of MacOS (older formats such as Mac OS Extended causes Time Machine to run VERY SLOWLY.  Lastly, the lack of formatting with encryption makes it less useful for environments were encrypted drives are required.

title: Blinking light is very annoying, but gets the job done
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
text: As silly as it might sound, my biggest complaint is that the white indicator light on the front of the drive blinks incessantly when the device's files are being written or read. Even the act of opening a folder on the drive makes it start to blink, and it's a bright light so this is pretty distracting. I've had to resort to flipping it over or covering the light.Read and write speeds are suitable for my needs (~30 GB transfer in couple mins), and capacity is as advertised. Compared to a 2017 Seagate 1TB drive I have and am happy with, this does feel like a little bit of a downgrade—the drive's case feels like it's made of a very cheap plastic (though sturdy), and feels a bit like a phone case.

text: I bought 2 of these, 1 2tb and the other 4tb. Both of them within a month started to give me strange problems. One of them, if connected to my computer but not actively being used, after a while it will essentially lock my computer. I would not be capable of ejecting the drive, if I tried to open the drive during this time period everything just freezes, and the taskbar disappears, screen goes black, the only way to get it to stop is to pull it out of the computer. Once I do that, like magic, everything starts to work normally, very strange. The other one takes too long to do anything, while suddenly starting to have the same issues as the other hard drive, although to a lesser degree. I'm just not happy overall, and will not be buying a seagate hard drive any time soon.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Very slow, writing failed after 1/3 full
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on December 7, 2021
text: The drive worked for about a week. When it worked, it was so very slow, there is literally no reason for this drive to use USB 3.0, USB 1.0 is sufficient for the drive's read and write speeds. The USB3 thing is just a gimick, making people think the drive is faster than older USB 2 drives. I was being patient though, since I don't expect to use the drive for anything other than backing stuff up occasionally. And then after filling it about 1/3 full, the drive started giving "unexpected device errors" when trying to copy files. Even windows 10 disk scan failed, due to a device error. This error causes windows explorer to freeze up, requiring a reboot to make my PC functional again. Returning the drive.Yes I got really unlucky with this drive. No, you probably shouldn't expect the same thing to happen if you buy one. Its just dumb bad luck that mine died. I would have kept it if it didn't die on me (because I'm lazy and I hate dealing with returns), but it isn't good enough for me to want a replacement. Definitely far too slow for any real day-to-day use.  Maybe it dying is a blessing in disguise.The 1 star is me being angry for wasting so much of my time on this drive.

title: Giving this one a ONE star.  Near impossible to get working
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 3, 2021
text: How hard is it to make a portable external hard drive.  It appears it isn't since there are tons of them out there.  So choose another one.  Its the install.  Quick install is one picture of plugging into the computer. Thanks Seagate.  I did that and nothing happens.  I have to select the windows install myself.  It loads and try's to register.  Then they direct to download all this other services and software and you cant get out......start over.  then I click to download software and it takes me to their Support internet site.  I am like ok now I am at support......  now what.  Oh.... you need to find your product....Huh? Your product just directed me here and now I have find the product?  Ok not a big deal.  Then I find my product and it directs me to download DiskWizard.  I do so and it locks up and freezes and then works....then freezes and doesnt respond.  I spent an hour trying to figure out.  Was so confused and frustrated I plugged it into another computer and it did the same crap....Finally download DiskWizard on a second Desktop and same thing.  I hit support and the guy is like.... for windows 10 we don't use DiskWizard we use Toolkit.  Huh? Where did that say that anywhere?  I would buy something else.  Save yourself the frustration with SEAGATE.

title: Lots of space. Didn't work after using it a few times.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2021
text: I am writing a review of the Seagate portable hard drive. I purchased the hard-drive so I could store projects that I was coding, and also storing some screen recordings and programming projects that took up a lot of space on my desktop. The hard-drive was working great the first times I used it. I was using the drive properly and completely disconnecting the hard-drive when I was taking my hard drive to work on projects outside of my home. The first few uses were great, but then I started to get errors on the hard-drive, and eventually all of my documents were erased from the hard-drive, or there was some projects that were still on the hard-drive that I did not need, but the ones I did need were erased from the drive. I tried contacting customer service to see if I could get a replacement, but there was no response after about two weeks. Portability and storage capacity are great. Probably won't buy seagate again, and just use something like BackBlaze to back-up files.

title: MUST Format on PC to use on Xbox One!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
text: The product serves its purpose. I needed an external hard drive so I could hold more data for my Xbox One. What I was disappointed with was that I couldn't format the external drive directly from my Xbox. I wasn't  able to do so until I first plugged the drive into my PC and changed the format to exfat. After trying this, I plugged the drive back into my Xbox One, and sure enough, "Format for games & apps" popped up..Some of these other reviewers made it seem like a chimp could do it by simply plugging it in. I was starting to feel like one after multiple troubleshoots. Wish I would have known this would be an issue before purchasing.

title: Just be prepared for issues

text: -Looks/feels cheap and flimsy (like one small fall will total it).-Formatting issues (mac)I purchased this item to move/store raw video files from another external. Here are frequent issues that I came across.-Will randomly hide files no matter how long they have been on the drive (files will return if you unmount and remount drive).-Cannot transfer more than 2 folders (around 12gb) at a time or you will randomly get a error 36 message (unmounting/recounting drive and then transferring 1 folder at a time is a work around).I've showered the internet to find any/all solutions to these problems and only a few helped intermittently.Overall I would not recommend this product if you plan on backing up large amounts of photos and videos. This is probably great for small occasional file storage.

title: Loose USB Connection
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2021
text: There's little to expect from an external HD. It sits there, and has storage. Not much to it.What I do know is that the USB connector is loose at the enclosure. If moved at all it could lose connection and cause your transfer to fail. I lifted it up to grab a stack of papers it was sitting on, and now my 1 tb backup (which takes a long time) failed. I had to start over again. If I were working directly from the drive (as some people do) it could have caused files to be corrupted and unrecoverable. Not good.Seagate is a well established brand, and I selected this drive based on my familiarity. I'm disappointed, and I won't trust the brand as much in the future. I'll be returning it after I find a replacement and wipe the drive. Pain in the butt.

title: DO NOT BUY THIS

text: This is my second Seagate external hard drive. The first one I'll take responsibility for messing up, however, this one... Ive had it literally for 9 days and in the middle of me editing it completely dies and says that I've ejected it ( which I didn't). Then it started beeping and I knew ( from my previous one) that when it beeps that is not good. The Rescue support isn't the most helpful... now all my footage is gone from the project I was working on and I need to buy a NEW hard drive when I literally just bought this one smh. I'm pretty upset because I read the reviews but thought that the good outweighed the bad.... NOPE.

title: great storage, but lost all game data
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 5, 2021
text: So review number 2.  Hard drive crashed within 3 months of buying it.  returning it to manufacture now.  It was supposed to come with one year data rescue in case it crashed.  and apparently that was bogus also.  This is a worthless product and I would not advise spending any money on it.WE have multiple PS4s, and are considering a PS5.  WE got tired of cleaning out games form the storage on the units we have, and decided to try a external portable device.  We were very excited, got it synced up, and transferred the game from the main PS4 consul to the storage drive.  Went back in a few weeks later to play one of the game we had transferred over,  my son and I had spend over 100 hours on it, and had lost everything.  Apparently the external only works if the games are played from it, it will not copy over any of the saves or game progress.  Which defeats the purpose of using this to make room on a consul without losing the games.  So big waste of money, and neither my son nor I am interested in playing our "saved" games anymore as rebuilding everything that was lost with the transfer isn't worth the time.

text: When I purchased the “Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive Portable HDD – USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox - 1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)“ I needed an external drive ASAP and this drive offered next day am delivery. I  usually buy WD or Corsair drives but I could get this by the following mourning so I bought it. When I first used it, the drive it was very slow backing up a computer. It was a troubled computer so I figured it was just a slow machine. When I transferred the data to my file server it was slow uploading; but since the source PC was in bad shape I just figured the data was problematic. I've used it twice since then and unfortunately the Seagate drive is just tragically slow. After looking at the Amazon reviews again I'm guessing it's just a defective drive so it's going back.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Transfer speeds vary but....
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2019
text: I was using a USB Hub since all of the USB ports are taken.I have 99% of data stores on 3 separate HDs; a long almost nightmare story behind that.I'm moving most of the data off onto this 2TB. A 1TB only holds 930GB. Any additional data will take time to fill this one.Transferring large amounts of data through a USB hub is inefficient and impractical. I've found they run on less power and therefore transfer much slower. The chances it can crash increase. I run a health check on all of my HDs at least every 3 to 6 months depending on who often I use them. After plugging it into the PC itself, the transfer rates increase. I'm sure the quality and brand of USB hub also affect how well it work.IMO, 2TB should be the standard as far as external storage is concerned.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Drives failed spectacularly, not once, but twice
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 7, 2022
text: I bought two of these to backup files on my desktop.I backed up the same files to each drive, and they were perfectly accessible and functional from the drives after being copied.A couple days later, I cleared the files from my desktop with the intention of restoring them later shortly thereafter. Only then did I discover about 80% of the files on the first backup drive were corrupted. The second backup drive proved to have the same issue. But because the corruption wasn't consistent among the files on each drive, I was able to recover about a third of them overall. A data recovery utility was able to salvage another 50% of them after lengthy repairs.My prior experience with Seagate drives was largely positive, but they'll never be my first choice moving forward. They had one job, and they failed spectacularly at it, not once, but twice.

title: This is not a drive you should rely on
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 2, 2021
text: I used this for my laptop and it worked perfectly. I disconnected this drive properly every time I don’t use the laptop for the day.  I disconnected it properly and had not connected it to my laptop for just one or two weeks to take a bit of a break. After I decided to use my laptop again and connected my drive before booting up my laptop like I always do. Once I logged in I couldn’t see my games that I had stored in my drive and I had to reinstall all of them back I tried restarting my laptop but I still can’t find my games not even the drive. my laptop can’t recognize it anymore when it always does. I don’t know if I missed something or that it’s broken but I need some answers because something as expensive as this drive that only takes a few weeks to start becoming faulty that was new is ridiculous.

So hold to your package, but best, stay away from this product.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2020
text: I’ve got two of these bad boys. One I’ve had for a year. I use it for storing and editing large amounts of .mov’s for work, and it gets the job done.The other one I got a month ago, and it failed on me today. I had to run disk utilities on it after it began buzzing and refusing to be recognized by the computer. Caused me a nightmare.If you’re in a pinch and need some storage, buy 2 of these and one up into the other. If you’re a professional doing a lot of heavy duty work, look somewhere else.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Lit up, but failed to backup
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 22, 2021
text: This was my third Seagate drive. The first worked well for several years then went dead. The second (a different model) is still in service on another computer after 5 years. So I was happy to buy another Seagate.But this one was a disappointment. I tried to use it to back up an older mac. It lit up, formatted and the computer said it was backing up. It was really slow and later, it displayed an error that it could not complete the backup. I assumed at the time it was that the computer I was backing up - an older model that I thought might be incompatible with the drive due to its age.I set the drive aside until I got my new iMac. Reformatted the drive and tried to back up. It appeared to initiate the back as before but again ended in the same failure message.  So sadly, I found out too late that the drive was at fault, not the computer. The return window is closed. My bad.Since my older Seagate is still in service, I might try the brand one more time. But not this model.

title: HORRIBLE PRODUCT, misleading product information, terribly disappointed with Amazon
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 28, 2020
text: I have been a big user and proponent of Amazon-no longer.  The last two products I've ordered from Amazon have not worked as advertised.  I've already submitted a review of the Dymo labeler that was supposed to work with Macs but nowhere does the copy indicate it does not work with Catalina.  I purchased this seagate external hard drive that states it's compatible with Macs. It downloaded about 1/3 of my pictures then I got an "Unknown Error" message stating it could not download the rest of the photos.  I called Amazon and was transferred to Seagate.  It turns out this product is made exclusively for Amazon- Amazon does not disclose this information.  Despite claims that it is  compatible with Macs it needs to be formatted to do so, there were no instructions that inform of this. Also the device cannot be located on the Seagate website. I called Amazon, was transferred to Seagate.  Over 1 hour was spent discussing my issue.  I did not want to simply return the device since it had several of my pictures on it.  Although patient, and ultimately not having to pay for a new product they were able to remove my pictures and will send me a new device, one that is made specifically for Macs.  I must send the original device back, without a refund, they are simply sending me a hopefully better replacement.  I'm furious at Amazon for their lack of transparency and the poor product description, that is likely written by the manufacturer.

title: PRE-FORMATTED FOR PC!!! BEWARE!

text: I purchased an almost exact product to use a time machine back-up for my personal Macbook Air. No problems. I got this one to dump extra files, videos, etc. to used between my 2 Macbook Airs (work and personal). Well, it arrived formatted for Windows PC and was prompting me to re-format for Mac. The product should not come pre-formatted in my opinion. That makes me think it was used and returned but not 'reset'. I am sure there are a lot of computer savvy people out there who think this is not a big deal, but I don't have time for it. Time wasted.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: I would trust a stranger on a bus with my wallet before I trusted this product again...
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021
text: I bought this at the very beginning of June, and it's now the beginning of July, of the same year I bought it. It's been one month. I've kept this external drive in my bag, safely padded whenever moved, or on my desk, and I've made sure to eject it correctly each time. I came back to my computer from a coffee break to access my designs for my job, and it starts to beep. The name wouldn't show up either. I tried a different cord and a different port at first, even had someone look at to see if anything could be recovered, and I've lost everything. I'm a broke college student needing to store my designs and work, only to receive thee most devastating blow. I find it important to note I did not drop this, not one single time.If this even matters, it felt a lot like cheap plastic. I don't know what a hard drive is supposed to feel like, but I had expected something more sturdier. Who knows. Keep looking for a different, better hard drive. I know they're expensive, but losing a hefty handful of money is a thousand times better than what I'm going through right now.

title: Started Out OK, but Connectivity Issues Ensued - BEWARE!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 27, 2020
text: I bought this in November 2019, by March 2020 it had connectivity issues. I replaced the USB cables and tried different ports, but connectivity remains intermittent. There is no indication of imminent device failure it just suddenly disconnects from my Windows 10 OS. I receive an I/O error message. All problems disappear upon reboot, but it is very annoying.I use this device to store video files. I'm glad I'm not using it as a 'working' drive as I think access would be a nightmare.I generally like the Seagate brand, but I'm underwhelmed by this device's performance and glitchy connectivity. I don't recommend it.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Unreliable. Crashed my Entire Computer
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2021
text: Worked fine for 1 week. After a week, the icon that appears next to the drive in "file explorer" disappeared. (It turned into a default windows "unknown file" icon rather than the Seagate icon that it was originally). Weird, but it still worked fine, so it was okay. One week later, I go to open file explorer, and file explorer hangs for a minute, then my entire computer crashes. This is a very high performance desktop computer that I only purchased a little over a year ago, mind you. I turn it back on, launch file explorer, and it crashes again. I turn it on for a third time, unplug my hard drive -- since I figure it might have something to do with it, and file explorer launches completely fine. Luckily I was able to access the files from the drive on another computer, but what if I couldn't, or what if I didn't have access to another computer? I can't risk putting any more files on this drive. It is unreliable and I will be returning it.

title: Easily broken, company won't help
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 21, 2022
text: I bought this drive shortly after Christmas and it broke just barely over a month after I got it, meaning I could no longer go through Amazon to return it. When I reached out to Seagate themselves, they told me they'd either send me the materials to send back my old drive and then send me a new one once they'd received it, or I could pay extra to get the new drive first and send the old one after. Great start, I chose the former. I receive an email confirming my phone conversation with customer support-- then nothing after that, nothing about the order they had to place for this exchange or anything. It's been about a week and I've already received a customer satisfaction survey, yet no indication I'm going to be able to exchange this drive that does nothing more than utter a dull beep now that my computer can't recognize it. Save your money, Seagate won't help you.

title: Files gone after half a dozen or so uses - this uses the infamous rosewood ST2000LM007 drive
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 2, 2020
text: Update: I managed to use chkdsk to recover some of the files. I discovered that inside is the notoriously bad rosewood ST2000LM007 drive. Google "ST2000LM007 reliability", these drives are known to fail w/out warning. Seagate's "Enjoy long term peace of mind with the included 1 year limited warranty" advertisement should have been a red flag. 1 year is "long term"? What a joke from their marketing department. But 1 year is as long as they want to take responsibility for it, so that should tell you something. Don't use this for irreplaceable backups and/or as primary storage.Original review:Never had a drive fail like this, should have paid more attention to the negative reviews, but instead trusted Seagate's past reputation and previous experience. I purchased in Aug '19 and copied some data for backup purposes. I recently made a back up of one of my computers, and did the same for another today. I went to copy a few more things back and forth today and the drive failed with Win10 telling me "drive corrupted, can't read it". Properties show 0 bytes capacity and 0 used. Some of my data was temporarily only on this drive so there's a good chance that's gone forever.This product deserves zero stars. Seagate does not cover data recovery in their warranty - they should for drives that fail so quickly.One other thing - the case feels cheap. It's in a flimsy plastic case and has no rubber feet to keep it from sliding around.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)

title: Hard drive died after only about 6 months
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 10, 2021
text: I plugged this thing in one day and my computer wouldn’t detect it I tried over and over and I noticed that whenever I plugged it in I was like an EMP because it disabled power to my keyboard and mouse and when I unplugged it power would be restored. I tried the same thing on another computer and the same thing happened. Power would be disabled for all usb devices. Also when I plugged it in my computer would sometimes detect it and I quickly tried surfing through it to a file and within seconds everything would freeze up again. This is pretty sad because I have another seagate 2 tb drive that I bought years ago and it’s still working perfectly to this day. I guess they don’t make them like they used to.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Dead after 2 weeks - Do NOT put your precious memories or files on this POS
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2021
text: I don't think I've ever written a review but this event made me make the effort. At least a decade of buying everything off of Amazon and this one really hit me in the gut. I guess you get what you pay for.I bought this Seagate drive 12 days ago. Had a bunch of data on it, most of which I backed up but not all of it. Today it died and I lost some very important data.Here is exactly how it happened. I have it plugged into my Mac by way of an Anker adapter. I have my Mac on my desk. As I slid the Mac from one part of the desk to the other, the drive and adapter fell off the table but did NOT hit the floor. It just dangled from the Mac.. that's it, that caused it to die. Confirmed with their support team.So think twice before you put your precious data on this device. It's delicate as hell compared to my old drive that has been around for 6 years, tossed in drawers, and dropped on the floor.

title: No support whatsoever/drive lasts about 6 months.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on October 4, 2021
text: Drive lasted from April to October. Complete failure. Was using for xbox and I never disconnected it. Just one morning turned on the system and the drive no longer was able to be read. Hmm, only 6 months of use and only 25% capacity used. Tried to contact Seagate to get my drive replaced while it's still under warranty.  Digital agents are slow to respond, if they respond at all. I've had three attempts where I respond to chat and no response happens over 10 minutes. The bots that just walk you through a troubleshoot menu when you first connect are not even helpful, and when you call the number listed on the site, it gives you three ads, if you decline them, they just hang up on you before you can reach a representative. The warrant/rescue service is not real from what I have spent hours trying to get help with it. I would never recommend buying one of these unless you want a disposable drive that works for a month or so.

location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2022
text: This device is absolute garbage. Right out of the box, the device immediately caused problems with my PC. The PC would run totally fine, the moment the hard drive was plugged in the PC would run so painfully slow and glitch out. The second the hard drive was disconnected, the PC performed as normal. I read several articles in how to fix this, none of them worked and while I was angry, atleast I had storage. Now, the thing refuses to work at all and I've lost hundreds of gigs of data. I was watching a video file when it all the sudden stopped working, then none of the files would load, now it won't even be recognized by any device I own. The hard drive will light up and then beep several times, I assume indicating that the device is corrupted. Easily the worst piece of tech I have ever purchased.

Reached out to seagate and they walked me through the steps and finally agreed that it was corrupt.I had to pay 30 dollars to return it for a different one. Shipping cost plus static bag.I received my new hard drive 2 weeks later and again it worked until I transferred files onto it. Now my computer wont read this new one.I have tried different computers, different cords, and everything in between. Seagate walked me through their steps and the hard drive will not work.Wasted $140 dollars in total for a paperweight.DO NOT BUY SEAGATE

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Do NOT rely on this to store your data, VERY slow and/or Unreliable!!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2021
text: Got one of these to replace another external HDD that was old and seemed fairly close to failing, figured it was the responsible thing to do. After spending an entire day writing things over (because the read/write speeds on this thing are MISERABLE), attempting to access the files left my computer attempting to initialize endlessly before Windows informed me that it timed out.After a couple of restarts and trying different USB ports, I tried to use Seagate's tools to fix it, but at that point the drive wouldn't show up at all. Taking some advice online, I tried checking Windows Disk Management, and the drive wouldn't Initialize at all. When attempting to get it to initialize, it reported a fatal hardware error as the cause.Because of this, we've now lost data that's nearly a DECADE old, much less all of my music and videos are now completely -gone-. And after doing some further research, this is NOT an uncommon problem with these types of Seagate drives- both the slow crawl to load after even partially filling up the drive, AND the hardware failure rate. Please please please learn from my experience, and take your business elsewhere.

title: doesn't have external power supply which apparently causes the device to lock and not function
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 26, 2019
text: I bought two of these (4TB for myself and 2TB for a friend).  The one lasted all of three weeks.  After Amazon and SEAGATE both tried to troubleshoot it, I was told it could 'lock' itself if you remove the cable at the wrong time.  Seagate did authorize a refund for the one that stopped working, but I asked if it would be better to purchase the model with the external power supply.  I was told 'yes'.  So I will purchase another one.  However, you can't return the 2TB unit with a totally damaged unit.  So I now have to warn my friend to be EXTREMELY careful about how he might disconnect the power cable when the unit is running.  Seems like a flaw in the design to me.  Having learned this, I should just be able to exchange for something with the external power.  Warning to anyone purchasing.  Look for the external power.  It apparently reduces the odds considerably of this being a way to accidentally 'lock' your drive (rendering it disfunctional).

title: Nothing but trouble
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 7, 2022
text: At first, the hard drive worked with my Asus computer. Then it didn't. I'd insert it into the computer, the computer would recognize it and open up windows file explorer, then randomly stop recognizing the drive existed. If I tried to transfer anything, it froze and then disconnected. Sometimes it started working again, but after transferring something, it started acting up again. I thought it was the Asus because the drive still worked on my very ancient Toshiba laptop, and then it worked on my new MSI... until today. I inserted it into the MSI and the computer didn't acknowledge it's existence. The Asus acknowledged it today, allowed me to transfer some stuff, and then started freezing up and disconnecting when I tried to do anything more. Now it's not connecting at all again... I'm really disappointed. I heard Seagate was a good, reliable brand.

title: Cheap and flimsy with a sad puppy.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2021
text: Upon opening the box, the device was ridiculously light and made of cheap plastics. I thought, "There's no way that this thing has physical spinning disks in there. Surely this must be the solid state version!" I plug it in to transfer 33GB of photos and I hear it start spinning to discover a whopping write speed maxing out at 36mb/s! Im so nervous to use this as an actual backup for resetting my desktop, that I'm returning it. It feels like it would break by the shear force of its own spin. But rest assured, the picture of the sad puppy with a broken drive congratulates you that your product comes with file backups through a third party "for when you need it most."

title: Did not work.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2021
text: I tried the external drive and my computer would not recognize it.  I called Seagate and after a wait, I got an tech agent, and explained my problem. I was immediately disconnected.  I waited probably 15 min and called back. My wait period was to be "greater than 10 minutes"...quite vague. After 30 min, I gave up and went to the website. Filled our the necessary info and got a "person", at least they gave a name as a person, and "they" said that they would be happy to help me with my problem. I waited and waited, probably 6-7 minutes for instructions, and NOTHING!  Tried typing a response, but would not accept it...probably because they hadn't given me instructions, and the procedure is set at the website. Left the website, went to Amazon to get an authorization to return the item, which I did yesterday through an UPS store.  I now have a different company's external drive and it works fine.

title: Not user friendly
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on July 24, 2021
text: I purchased this a few weeks ago in hopes to store all my photography files since macbook air isn’t the best in terms of storage. I finally got some free time & tried to figure it out and first opening the box, I was impressed with how small it was for 2TB of data storage. I could not figure out for the life of me how to get this to store my files though. Its advertised as compatible for macs but opens up and immediately says its for windows but did say something about macs which confused me? Even with my boyfriends help, who is a computer nerd, we couldn’t figure out how to back up my files. This isn’t very user friendly and the lack of instructions didn’t help. I don’t have the time nor patience to sit here for hours trying to figure out how to do this so I’m pretty disappointed for having had wasted $60. If you aren’t computer savvy, I don’t recommend this, it’s more of a headache than anything.

title: Hard drive failed after a few hours of use :(
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 4, 2021
text: I was really excited to use this external hard drive to download games since my laptop doesn’t have enough storage for that. Within a few hours of using it it started beeping at me :( I did some research and found that the beeping means that the hard drive is failing. I tried to safely eject it and plug it back in but my laptop was unable to read the hard drive so I just unplugged it, let it sit and tried plugging it back in. Still beeping... I definitely think it is fried and for $60 I was hoping that I wouldn’t have any problems, ESPECIALLY since it is brand new.

text: I transferred all my photos to this external hard drive in July and August of 2021, right after I purchased it.  The hard drive has sat on a temperature controlled shelf ever since.  I plugged it in to access my photos in May of 2022 - less than a year later - and the hard drive doesn't work.  It just makes a beeping noise.  I've tried it on multiple devices, and it's a no go.  I remember reading a few reviews on this product mixed in with the good ones warning that the hard drive wasn't any good.  I wish I had listened.  I lost a lot of valuable photos.  Don't make my mistake!  Buy a different hard drive!

title: Worst customer service I've ever experienced

text: I contacted the customer service department because my hard drive had stopped working for my ps4, at first the lady Loretta that spoke with me was polite but wanted to further state that this specific hard drive is not meant for a ps4 but only pc and that she could not help with a replacement due to me not using the hard drive properly. I proceeded to tell her I have have warranty and that I think its only right that they send me a replacement due to the fact that in the description of the product it says it works for the ps4. As soon as I mentioned that, Loretta has completely ghosted me & will not reply to my emails. It's been over a month & I know her job is not that hard. Although the product is decent, I would not recommend this to anyone due to the poor customer service provided by the company. Maybe I'm more annoyed of her ignoring my emails? I'm not sure but they definitely have lost a customer in me & I strongly advise you to do the same.

Disappointed that Amazon still has not corrected the website description despite several years' worth of other customers who discovered the same thing.

title: Don't do it!!!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2020
text: I believed the reviews and bought this unit, although not my brand of choice.  While the drive initially does work as it should and back ups occur as normal, although VERY slow, my drive was inaccessible after 7 months.  I keep all drives stored away in safe, cool, location in my home and all my back up drives work and I have had some of them for over 12 years.  Now, this drive is unresponsive after 7 months.  WOuldn't care so much because I just use it for back up but my old laptop just died and all my data from that laptop is stored on this drive.  7 months folks!!!!  What a waste.  After 2 days of searching online and their website for warranty, found here from another reviewer - seriously!  Try and search for this unit on their website, you will find nothing on it.  Now, I will be spending more time trying to contact these people to get another unit or repair but that does nothing for the data I have and need that is/was stored on this drive.

title: Updated review (Changing star rating from 1 to 4)
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on January 19, 2021
text: My mistake...My laptop was setup to store all the files on Onedrive (no local copy). When I first tried to take a backup on the external hard disk, it was trying to download all 80GB before copying it. This resulted in it giving very high estimates to complete and the copy was very slow too.I got all the files as "local copy" on my laptop and took a backup. It copied it with about 70-80 Mbps, which I guess is acceptable.~~~Tried taking back up of about 80GB on a Windows 10 machine (16GBRAM, 3.1 USB). After 5 minutes, the popup windows shows "More than 1 day" time required. Tried in small group (80 GB too much?). For 17 GB, it kept showing "More than 1 day" for about 10 minutes then changed it to "7 hours 53 minutes".Tried online Chat with Seagate. They couldn't help in a session that was on for more than 30 minutes. Tried calling their number, was on hold for another 30 minutes.Logged in to Amazon and returned.Really disappointed.

It is not worth it unless you pay more for more memory to only use a quarter of it.

text: I bought this portable drive thinking my photos and documents were stored in a safe place.... wrong, it turns out that after changing the portable drive to another computer the drive was not recognized and did not work.  I lost all my documents stored on that device, I contacted the company that distributes them STX Seagate.com and their answer was that I have to contact Amazon for a solution or a replacement because the code number on the divise didn't match the code number they had,.  Hahaha they offer frustration free, that's not true! so if you are going to buy this product I recommend you thinking twice before you lose your photos and folderssorry but I do not recommend it!

I tried the seagate tool (seatool) and it showed that it had faulty sectors. short and long tests failed to perform. the hard drive essentially died suddenly, with no explanation. I lost all of my information in that drive.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Horrible Horrible Horrible, Especially For MacBook Pro
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 17, 2019
text: I'm familiar with this brand– I use a backup drive by them, which worked ok until just a couple weeks prior to my purchasing this external hard drive. It should have removed previous material and updated to the new material on the computer, but stopped removing and wouldn't function. My computer then began giving me warnings that there was not enough space on my hard drive, so I thought I'd read through multiple reviews. Not sure why, but opted to purchase this one due to reviews. Bad idea. It would only allow me to transfer small files. It would freeze my entire computer, forcing me to power it down manually and then boot it up again to get access to my computer again. THEN, I would attempt to transfer the larger files and it would say that it was "estimating time". It would say this for hours. It would stop working if my computer went to sleep. I sat the first time for two hours keeping my computer from sleeping, because it said it would take 2 hours to transfer. 6 hours later, no dice. HUGE waste of money and time. Won't EVER purchase Seagate anything again. No number for customer service/tech support provided in my packaging. Returning it. Don't waste your time. Good reviews must have been purchased or perhaps for PCs?

I have my systems and everything on surge protectors etc so everything but this was fine.Ever since then my PS4 or my PC won't recognize it even exist, I called Seagate customer support and after two hours of them fiddling around with it on remote-control desktop I was told that it would cost me a service charge of $200 so they could pay a tech to fix it.I told them I both didn't pay that much to buy it and that nothing I had on it was worth that.6/10 while it worked0/10 for Seagate customer support, it not lasting even a year and Seagate Not being honest and trying to trick me into that service charge, I had to ask specifically why and what the charge was and they beat around the bush before telling me; going on about "It's just a small service charge".Still haven't got it fixed.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: DRIVE FAILED AFTER 1 MONTH
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2021
text: I purchased this note even a month ago and it has failed spectacularly. I usually always buy my drives as portable drives so I can pull them out of the enclosure at a later date and use them internally. This one I did it right off the bat. It performed wonderfully up until just earlier. The drive started hanging occasionally. I went to try to de fragment it in hopes that it just needed to organize the drive. Nope stuck at 0% de fragmented for 2 hours. Tried using chkdsk. Hopefully later tonight I can salvage some data from it but I'm not optimistic. I will no longer be purchasing Seagate products as of now. I've had 5 dollar beat up used drives last years and this couldn't even last a month... how pathetic. Plus now I cant even get a refund for it because its out of its enclosure.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Rendered defective within a week
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021
text: I bought this as a replacement to my old 1TB that I'd been using for my PS4. Once I received this hard drive, I started moving all of my games from my old hard drive, to system storage, and then onto the new hard drive. Things were going smooth for a few days, until I noticed it would constantly disconnect from the PS4 while still being plugged in and everything. I even made sure that it would remain powered on while the PS4 was in rest mode, but it kept disconnecting and needing to be repaired each time. After I had finally finished transferring all my games (about 700GB worth), the hard drive frequently kept disconnecting until it finally stopped being read by my PS4. Even after rebuilding database, it wouldn't even pop up to give me the option to format it again. After one last attempt at formatting it on my laptop so I could try using it one last time, it ended up doing the same thing and kept disconnecting while still plugged in securely

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: It's Not Slow. It's Slooooooow.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on May 15, 2020
text: Connected this with the provided USB cable to the USB 3.x port on a new Alienware laptop.Transferring a bunch of files and the data speeds range from ~45MB/s all the way down to ~700KB/s (!!!). Average is below 10MB/s. Not remotely close to the advertised specs.Outrageous.Tech supports: only thing to recommend is defrag and format the drive.Again, Outrageous.There's NO reason to defrag then format a drive. Or visa-versa. None the less I had Windows take a look at it: 0% fragmented (of course).Should I have to reformat a brand new, pre-formatted drive? Only if the manufacturer really screwed up.So far it's taken the better part of two days to back up less than 1.5 Terabytes of data.Well, poop, guess it'l be going back.

title: Own Two, Both Fail solid
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2021
text: Running the latest Acronis True Image 2021 backup software.  Trying to create a Windows 10 Survival Bootable backup of my new Samsung PCIe 4 7000MB/s NVMe SSD drive.  Acronis repeatedly fails with file system error.  After killing that process Windows 10 does not find any problems but it will always fail.This drive is 25 months old and is out of warranty.  The problem is that it is only used as a backup and has only been used about 4 times for one day only in its entire life.  The rest of the time it is in storage and offline to prevent damage from virus or ransomware.The other drive of the same type and capacity is four years old but also died solid within two years.  The other failure is solid and just hangs.I will not be purchasing anymore Seagate small portable drives.

Something is definitely weird. Tried another drive and it worked fine. Switched the cord and still a no go. I’ve had issues with Seagate in the past so I should have known better but I thought it was a good price. I do not recommend.

title: NOT Compatible with macOS Monterey 12.2.1
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 11, 2022
text: The listing claims this Drive is MAC Compatible so I purchased one, and promptly returned it believing it was defective. Then I purchased a second one and it too was not recognized by my late model MacBook Pro using OS Monterey 12.2.1 operating system. I went to the Seagate Website and there was a note that some Mac's wouldn't recognize some of the Hard Drives......which isn't mentioned in the listing. Fortunately, Amazon made both returns relatively painless.  I have one of these Hard Drives that I use with my Dell Laptop and it has worked great for years which is why I chose it. Just be aware if you have a newer version of  MAC.

text: Be forewarned--this is not a plug and play device if you're using a Mac.  After Googling why I couldn't create folders or drag-n-drop on this drive, I did some Googling and the Seagate website advised I would have to reformat the drive for it to work on a Mac.  After following the instructions on the Seagate website, the device is no longer recognized by my computer.  I currently have a $60 brick sitting on my desk.  And the best part?  Seagate customer service is only open from 8-6 on weekdays, when I'm working.  Thanks for nothing.  If I could give this product less than one star I would.

title: If you are purchasing for Xbox One, Series X or Series - DON'T
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2021
text: It appears that Microsoft has done some sort of update for the XBox that makes it where it will not recognize a lot of the external hard drives.  My daughter's stopped recognizing her Seagate drive abruptly after flawless use for over a year.  I assumed it had gone bad and bought another one like it.  The console would not recognize it either.  On a whim, I purchased the Seagate one that has the "Halo" person on it - it's the "official" Xbox drive.  The console saw it immediately.  Clearly it's something they have done in an upgrade somehow but just know that if you are having difficulties with the console seeing the external HDD, don't buy this one because it won't see it either.

title: Died after 6 months with low to medium usage - Xbox external drive
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2021
text: Drive worked great for 6 months. Purchased June 2021 and died 12/30/2021. Was used frequently for first few months  and used sparingly the last 2 months (less than 5 hours per week). Xbox won’t recognize the drive anymore. Switched cables to no avail. Tried other computers and they don’t recognize it either (including using disk part and disk management). Shucked it to try to connect directly to computer with the same results. The drive spins up and led lights up but can’t be recognized. Has never been dropped or mishandled ( was plugged into rear port on xbox and remained on a shelf behind tv/Xbox). Would recommend a drive other than this as a gaming console external hard drive.

Don't buy it.

text: I call BS on this drive. It specifically states it is for Mc/PC but it is not...you have to BUY AN UPGRADE or go through a complicated reformatting process. And the fine print of their BS policies state if you reformat drive you voice warranty and you void your one year rescue protection. I am getting a little sick of Amazon not enforcing truth in advertising. You shouldn't have to wait until you get the product to find out it was all a slick lie. And reformatting for Mac/PC should not be complicated but the BS this is spouting makes it complicated. So I either reformat and lose my protections or return it. Leaning towards returning it right now because I am so disgusted.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Not as described. Not USB 3.0
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on June 8, 2020
text: Received drive in plastic packaging in cardboard box, as other customer images show. Appears to have been repackaged - I bought the same 2TB Seagate drive some time ago and it came in proper packaging. Appearance of enclosure itself looks and feels cheaper. Don't know if things have changed, but the cheaper appearance makes me worry about how drive will hold up.The real kicker is that I bought this for my PS4, but when I tried hooking it up it wasn't compatible. PS4 requires an external drive to be connected, between 250GB-8TB, and be USB 3.0. Only thing I can think of is it that the included cord was not USB 3.0 as advertised. I tried a different cord, and it worked, but I'm extremely disappointed that the included cord was not 3.0 compatible, and I would have been more disappointed had I not had a different cord to use, and wouldn't have been able to use the drive at all.I am usually forgiving but when I order something I expect the advertised product, which I feel this failed to deliver.

title: Quit working after 4 months
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 17, 2022
text: This HD quit working after 4 short months. It started beeping one morning and from then on, I could not access the data, could not get it to register on any computer (I tried multiple), and could not get it to work at all. After calling Amazon support, I was directed to Seagate directly since I was out of my return window. It was a long and ardous process with Seagate to get a replacement sent and even then, I had to pay for shipping back and forth.  Maybe I got a lemon but I would not take a chance with my data on this HD again.

Would have been money ahead just to select a bunch of moderately important files and immediately delete them.

I wish they sold a version that I could just plug in and use with my mac... Im so beyond irritated right now. Im leaving for Iceland in two days and I have a bunch of memory cards full of images and not enough space on my mac, I was hoping I could transfer everything to this so I could then get things off the memory cards so I could take photos, but now I'm in a panic feeling like I have to just buy more memory cards because I cant figure this thing out. I know part of the problem is that I just cant figure it out, but Im so annoyed that I even have to. I guess Im just a stupid impatient millennial but Im still leaving a bad review because again, Im a stupid impatient millennial.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: DO NOT ORDER THIS ITEM OR ANY TECHNOLOGY FROM AMAZON
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2019
text: I ordered this item and after 2 weeks no computer could recognize the hard drive. It made a weird sound on every computer I tried it on and I tried it in multiple computers. It was defective. I hate to have anyone go through what I went through. I lost a lot of data on it. Lots of work hours! I could not send it back because I could not get any computer to recognize it in order to wipe it clean of my data, thus risking a breach in personal and work information. I lost a lot of time I devoted to my work, compromised multiple computers, and did not receive a full refund from Amazon for the principal of the thing. It wasn't just the hard drive I lost. I have been a long-standing Amazon Prime customer so this is very unsettling. I would never order technology from Amazon again. I have never had difficulty through Staples and other places and have purchased may portable hard drives because I need them often.  This is really a bad move to order this through Amazon.

text: ***Update: After less than 4 months after purchase, the drive is no longer recognized by my computer when plugged in. It is a brick.This device is wonderful other than the fact it can never be ejected or safely removed. The whole point of an external hard drive is to offer portability and flexibility with your data. This device ALWAYS says that it is in use when you try to safely eject it. I have tried every tip and trick I could find on the internet including on Seagate's website. I thought it might be my computer, but every other hard drive and flash drive I have will safely eject. At this point, I have to turn my laptop off just to be able to unplug the drive. This is wildly inconvenient at times.

text: This device malfunctioned after only 2 weeks.  It was not dropped or handled improperly.  I was in the middle of transferring photos from my camera to the device when it suddenly disconnected.  I called the tech support and was on the phone for hours and passed to 3 different people before they told me that it would need to be mailed in.  I had a newborn photoshoot stored on it as well as 100s of travel photos that I didn't have backed up yet.  They asked which were most important to save.  38 days later, I received an e-mail saying they couldn't retrieve any of it.  Then it proceeded to say that the improper handling or dropping of the item was the cause.  I never once dropped it.  I only used it twice, and it broke the second time I did.  Would never ever trust this brand again and definitely do not recommend this product.

text: Stay away from this drive- it has known manufacturing defects. The brand new drive I bought would disconnect itself every time I slightly touched the cable. I know my computer is not the issue because all of the other USB devices I use work just fine. I contacted Seagate support and they said it was probably the cable or the port- it is a known manufacturing defect. I returned my drive to Amazon and received a new one. That new one had the same issue. I returned that one and bought a Western Digital hard drive that works great and has no issues.

title: This Thing is Complete Junk and Appears to Be Used Product
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2020
text: Do not buy this garbage, it is complete junk. It appears that I received a used hard drive... The shipping box arrived generic white sticker holding the box shut, but upon opening the shipping box I noticed that the plastic packaging that holds the hard drive was already opened (was basically just two plastic sheets laying on top of one another with the hard drive freely flopping around in between). The casing of the actual hard drive has finger prints and smudges all over with additional scratches around the cable port.I don't know if I received a returned item or what, but this is unacceptable. Moreover, the quality of the product is a bit disconcerting, I have cases for chewing gum in my bag that feel more robust than this "portable" hard drive...it is flimsy and feels fake. Even without the appearance of being a used item, I would be hesitant to store anything meaningful on this hard drive... poor, poor, poor quality on this product.

title: Formatted for PC
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 6, 2020
text: This product is advertised as being compatible with a PC or a Mac. This is only partially true. When I first plugged it into my MacBook Pro, it never showed up (on a Mac, any external plug-in device automatically shows up on the desktop when it's plugged in). Turns out it was only formatted for a PC, like something out of the 1990s. I had to manually reformat the drive and it still wouldn't work. I reformatted it again and it finally worked. There are a zillion drives out there that are plug-and-play capable for PCs and Macs. This is not one of them.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: HORRIBLE PRODUCT that died unexpectedly
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on May 8, 2020
text: Literally out of nowhere, my Seagate started making beeping sounds and my computer would not recognize it at all. This happened only SIX MONTHS after I bought it. I called tech support and the guy said he's heard of this issue before and he thinks it's just a faulty cord. He tried to sell me another cord lol. Instead I took it to the Geek Squad to have them take a look. The guy tried five different cords and none of them changed the situation. He said it was completely dead. Nothing even happened to it. Why did it do this?? I'm a freelance graphic designer....absolutely ALL of my client's design work, invoices, business templates, tax info, personal photos, etc. was on that hard drive. I lost EVERYTHING. It took me months to rebuild all of my work from the ground up (unpaid of course). Well lesson learned...shame on me for not backing up my work on a cloud-based storage system. That's what I'm doing now :(

title: Crashed after one use. Lost pictures/videos
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 2, 2021
text: Crashed after ONE use. Lost all the pics and vids I stored on it. I spoke with Seagate support for literal hours (took forever!!) and they did say they could try to save lost files since the device was corrupted BUT I would not get refunded for the product but rather would be sent a replacement harddrive. I don't trust these harddrives at all after this one died almost instantly and after losing those pictures so I just returned to Amazon instead for a refund. I switched to an American made external harddrive. Will never purchase Seagate again. Built cheaply and poorly. Very disappointed! 10 year anniversary trip pictures and videos lost forever.

title: DO NOT BUY
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on November 7, 2021
text: Do not waste your time. I regret buying this. I had all my games stored on here. Had it for 3 months but only used it maybe 10x. Today I was playing a game, and the game crashed. Thought it was an issue with the game, nope, turns out it was the HD. Restarted my laptop and now the HD won’t detect on any of my laptops, not even in disk utility. Amazon is sending me a new one that should arrive by tomorrow evening, but I’m sure I’ll have the same issue. Just don’t waste your money on this. Big waste of time and money.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: TWO failed drives in a row...UNRELIABLE!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 6, 2021
text: Needed an external HD to compile family pictures and video. Bought the 2TB drive, and while using, the drive kept disconnecting from the computer. That's scary, having to hope you don't lose data in midstream.Sent back as defective, requested an identical drive to replace it...the first was probably just the occasional bad one that got through, right?Wrong. Started transferring files to the 2nd one, seemed okay, then started transferring our converted 8mm home movie files, and the drive once again disconnected during the copy process.No way will I trust this drive for anything, much less priceless family memories.Both of these failed with less than 24 hours on them.Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice....this one goes back for a refund. I'll find a more trustworthy storage device.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Wasted hours when it stopped working
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 17, 2021
text: The drive worked well coming out of the box, though obviously slower than solid state drives.  After a bit over a month (just outside the return window!), it intermittently failed as my Time Machine backup drive.  I spent hours troubleshooting it before being told it's a problem with the drive.  We then spent an hour online and on the phone arranging a prompt replacement (otherwise waiting for a week or two).  With all that done, I should have just cut my losses, thrown it away, and bought some other brand.  Now I need to return this bricked drive and hope that my private data isn't compromised.  Very frustrating.

title: How was I supposed to use this?
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2021
text: When the HDD arrived I had to go back on my Amazon account because I thought I had bought the wrong thing. The item had no case, it was wrapped in anti static material to protect its parts, and there was no way to connect a cable to it. I paid for an acceptable version, with the expectation there would be some cosmetic damage but this was unusable. If the point was for me to buy the parts to fix it, the price needed to be faaar lower. I bought a brand new model at Walmart for less than it would have taken me to buy the parts I needed to fix the one that was sent to me, not to mention the time cost. Very subpar experience.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: READ the negative reviews!
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2021
text: If this external drive had a 30-day return window, it failed on day 31.  It functioned erratically for the first 30 days, and then just quit working altogether.  Being a bit of a tech nerd, I tried several different data recovery programs, but none of them worked, because this was a hard mechanical failure.  Upon closer inspection, I find that this drive was designed to be OEM for certain manufacturer's computers. NOT FOR RESALE!  But, due to some overstock refurb BS, it was packaged in a plastic case, and sold as an external drive.  1yr Rescue Service was worthless.If you can pay a little more for a drive that is not from Seagate or Western Digital, your money would be well spent.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Failed with an IO error on first backup, filesystem rendered useless.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2021
text: I purchased this a couple of weeks ago. When I plugged it into my PC to back things up from another HDD using rsync, the filesystem on this device ended up in an unrecoverable state.The rsync process got stuck in an IO system call, ended up in Uninterruptable Sleep mode (`D`). I rebooted the machine. Plugged the Seagate drive back again, the NTFS file system was corrupted.I will need to reformat it to `ext4` and try again. If you use this HDD with Linux and rsync, I would suggest you reformat it first, as soon as it arrives.

text: We normally never leave bad reviews but this one is worth mentioning. Had to get two before finally having to return them. The first one came and as I am doing my business, it froze and then crashed. It did that an additional two more times. So replaced that one and the next one was just as bad. Reformatted it and it was working fine until it didn’t. It literally disappeared and I couldn’t find it whatsoever which means it was broken. I looked for it on two computers, as wel as in recovery modes and no luck. I would not recommend this product. The speeds were also awful in response time. Very confused as to how this had so many positive reviews. It does appear that in recent months the reviews are more negative than positive.

Tried everything to trouble shoot with Xbox (power cycle, restart, different plug in spot, making sure the power settings did not say turn off storage when xbox is off, even reset Xbox software) and finally tried it on my MacBook and the MacBook could not recognize it either. Now the device never shows up when you plug it in. Waste of money and time trying to trouble shoot.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Worked for a few days but ended up having connectivity issues.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on April 25, 2021
text: Bought this for additional internal storage for my NVIDIA Shield Pro. It worked fine for the first few days. I was able to download my movies to it with no issues. After the 2nd day, I relocated it upstairs so I disconnected the power to Shield. After that, Shield had a hard time communicating with it. Shield would scan for hours and never detect it. It would connect after a few more tries but would fail to connect again after a while. I spent almost the entire day to determine it is the Seagate that is crashing the Shield. Not sure if this is just one bad hdd but I’m returning it. Thinking of just getting a WD.

title: No recomiendo comprarlo
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
text: Confié ciegamente en este disco duro externo por ser "una marca reconocida". Le he metido alrededor de 300 GB de información, fotos y videos.Después de 3 semanas, apenas 4 usos, el disco duro externo Seagate ya no pudo leerlo ninguna computadora ni laptop.Lo envié a la fábrica de Seagate, sólo para que me respondieran: "no pudimos recuperar ninguno de sus archivos".Simple y sencillamente se eliminaron todos mis archivos, fotos y videos desde el 2005 hasta el 2020.Se eliminaron como si nada muchos buenos recuerdos de mi vida, y Seagate no te soluciona nada. Alrededor de 30,000 fotos desaparecieron de la nada.Te recomiendo NO COMPRAR UN DISCO DURO EXTERNO DE SEAGATE. Busca mejor comprar de otra marca.La peor decisión de mi vida fue comprar este disco duro externo y confiar ciegamente en Seagate.

title: 2 of 3 units failed within a few weeks.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on March 7, 2021
text: I have purchased 3 of these units, and 2 have failed within a few weeks of use. I'm expected the third on to fail also, so I'm switching to a different brand.I'm using a Mac, and formatted the drives per Seagate's instructions. All goes well, for a while. Then I get "backup failed" messages. Reformatting the drive, then doing an initial backup (again) (which takes several hours), seems to sometimes work. But the problem recurs.Perhaps it's related to the failure - but these units make a strange noise every time they start their read/write process.My previous backup drive, a Seagate FreeAgent Goflex operated flawlessly on the same Mac, in the same environment, for several years.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Waste of Money
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2020
text: I was using it for Time Machine backups, but after one backup, the next time it would freeze up mid-backup, Disk Utility said it was corrupted, so I had to erase it. The purpose is to save a series of incremental backups over time, not erase the previous one every time.I returned the first one under warranty, and that went smoothly, but I had to pay postage, so that adds to the cost of the drive, plus the aggravation of mailing it and not having the use of it for 2 or 3 weeks. So now it has happened again. I'm not going to use it for Time Machine any more, let's see if it can handle straight copying.

title: Malfunctioned in three days...buy another brand
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 19, 2020
text: I wanted extra storage to download photos from a photo site that was shutting down.  Spent three days downloading my treasured pictures and on the fourth day it chirped a few times and died.  My laptop could not find it anymore...just a question mark where it previously said Seagate.  Tried everything then went out and purchased a brand new laptop to plug it into as was recommended.  The new laptop told me the Seagate had a malfunction.  I read that the support was not good and frankly at my age I probably wouldn't have a clue if they gave me a list of technical things to try...I just believe my new laptop.  Every time I think of the photos I lost I cry.

title: This 2 TB model is NOT compatible with Macs.
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2021
text: Don't be fooled by the ad on Amazon for a drop and drag ext. hard drive by Seagate. Maybe with PCs but not with Macs. Couldn't drag and drop anything. False advertising. Amazon should remove the product from their line of hard drives or at the very least make Seagate state that the product does not drag and drop for Macs. I've run into this problem with many other products. Western Digital is the only one that I've found that works by dragging and dropping for Macs - also La Cie.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: These are UNBOXED items, not factory sealed,
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2020
text: I'm reviewing Seagate 2T drive B07CRG94G3. I'm very uncomfortable with hard drives that are not factory packed. Malware is a thing. It should be clearly stated that these are not packed by the manufacturer and therefore could have been tampered with. They do not arrive shrink wrapped. Pricing should reflect this.Also, they are NOT plug and play for Mac. They are NFTC and must be reformatted for mac before you can save anything to them.

product_name: Seagate Portable 2TB External Hard Drive HDD — USB 3.0 for PC, Mac, PlayStation, & Xbox -1-Year Rescue Service (STGX2000400)
title: Cheap casing - Easily Broken
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on September 8, 2019
text: I purchased this portable drive to transfer my files from my computer which doesn't have a large hard drive and was nearly filled. After putting all of my important files onto it, and having had it for about 3 weeks, the drive has stopped working. My best guess is that it was somehow damaged in the computer case because the casing for the drive is made of thin, cheap plastic which is prone to being squeezed. Bottom line - the construction lead to the damage and loss of function. Now I have no files. I would not recommend this product, though I would say I expected more from Seagate. I have used their products for decades and have never seen shotty construction like this for one of their products until now.

title: Slow to the point of unusable
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States 🇺🇸 on February 24, 2021
text: I wasn't expecting much from this in terms of performance, but I was expecting it to actually be usable for transferring files.  Connect the drive, kick off a file copy... and immediately get errors from robocopy.  OK, maybe I just need to use fewer threads, that makes sense, right?  Drop down to a single thread file copy.The thing has a peak speed of about 5 MB/sec in my tests, averaging less than about half that; a far cry from the advertised 120MB/sec max speed.  I can't recommend this drive for any purpose, and won't be buying Seagate again.

title: Barely functional
location_and_date: Reviewed in the United States on November 1, 2018
text: I'm surprised by all the positive reviews.  I'm wondering if mine was just defective.  It won't connect through a USB 3.0 hub, a USB 3.0 extension cable, a USB 2 extension cable, or my TV!  It opened up when I connected it directly to my PC, and I could transfer files.  I brought it over to the USB port on my TCL Roku TV and the media app didn't see it.  I have a 32GB USB stick that works fine on the TV.  Useless drive at least in my experience.  Like I said, maybe mine was defective, but it worked on one of the USB ports so... Idk, but not recommended by me.
